The standard doorway is centrally located along the interior wall, while the vertical architectural support structure is further down the hallway. The large, rectangular fixture covered with various papers (the noticeboard) is positioned near the stairwell, making it a candidate for being between the two. The single chair, on the other hand, is near the doorway and placed inside the adjacent room. Comparing heights, the noticeboard is mounted higher on the wall than the chair, which sits near ground level. The noticeboard also occupies a middle ground spatially—neither as close to the doorway as the chair nor as far as the support structure.
reasoning.final_answer: The large, rectangular fixture covered with various papers (the noticeboard) is the object positioned between the standard doorway and the vertical architectural support structure. It is mounted higher on the wall compared to the single chair, which is located closer to the doorway and at a lower height.
